title: How to reduce redundancy in writing - Quora

response.answer_text: Don’t worry about it on your first draft. Just get it all down. On subsequent drafts, pay attention; get rid of most words that do nothing for the space they take; words like very, there, most adverbs, is, was, always, nearly, suddenly, and whatever dialogue tags that aren’t need to make sense of who is speaking and adverbs in dialogue tags
How do you reduce redundancy in writing? This is such a fundamental question… can you elaborate? Is this fiction? Non-fiction?
